member.summary: Essentially an event, that this page instance is about to "go away" because Next or Finish was pressed. The page can refuse the Next but this is NOT recommended. The page should send its data, if any, to its owner for processing before the is called with .
member.param: The page that will be shown next, likely the next page in the sequence. You can point this parameter to another page if you need to control the sequence of pages. If the value then this is the last page.
Set to to prevent the Wizard from advancing to the next page. This does NOT cause a full Cancel of the dialog. The value is passed in as .

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage.OnLeavingPageBackward(Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Essentially an event, that this page instance is about to "go away" because Back was pressed. The page can refuse the Back but this is NOT recommended. The page should "Cancel" any data it has already sent to its owner for processing before the parameter is called with .
member.param: The page that will be shown next, likely the previous page to this one in the page order. You can point this parameter to another page if you need to control the sequence of pages.
Set to to prevent the Wizard from advancing to the previous page. This does NOT cause a full Cancel of the dialog. The value is passed in as .

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage.OnEnteringPageForward(Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage)
member.summary: Essentially an event, that this page instance is about to be shown because Next was pressed. The previous page has already been told about the change. This page should "get" any data it needs from its owner for displaying. If this page has InitiallyEnableNextButton false then the button is already disabled; this method should verify the button should stay disabled (if user has already come here, hit Back then Next again to me, likely Next should be enabled, or not...)
member.param: The page that was just shown prior to Next being pressed.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage.OnEnteringPageBackward(Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage)
member.summary: Essentially an event, that this page instance is about to be shown because Back was pressed. The previous page has already been told about the change. This page should "get" any data it needs from its owner for displaying. If this page has InitiallyEnableNextButton false then the button is already disabled - this method must enable it if so desired.
member.param: The page that was just shown prior to Back being pressed.

member.name: P:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.WizardPage.NextButtonInitiallyEnabled
member.summary: Defaults to . Sets whether or not the "Next" (or "Finish" for the last page) button is initially enabled. Pages can disable "Next" initially, then enable it as desired as the user fills out data entries on the page. This behavior is highly encouraged rather than always enabling the "Next" button but smacking the user with a "stupid user you can't do that" if he tries to hit Next without entering all the necessary information on the page.

member.name: T:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.ThreadWorker
member.summary: Class that manages the work that a thread would perform by encapsulating both the thread and the item of work to be done by the thread. Use the ThreadProc method in as your ThreadStart parameter to the Thread constructor. You will need to override PerformWork abstract method to supply the code that is supposed to be executed by the thread. This class provides support for cancelling the work item. The behavior of Cancel can be overriden by derived classes. The default implementation is to Abort the thread.

member.name: T:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.FPUExceptionDisabler
member.summary: Disable FPU Exceptions as .NET requires

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.FPUExceptionDisabler.Disable
member.summary: Disable FPU exceptions.
member.remarks: The .NET framework expects FPU exceptions to be disabled. When they are not, windows forms applications usually get an unhandled arithmetic exception initializing fonts. FPU exceptions can be enabled by misbehaving code that attaches itself to processes. Examples include spyware and character extension utilities (AllChars is one). For these, calling this method at the very start of application start up is usually sufficient. Some print drivers can also enable FPU exceptions when called. For these, it may be necessary to call this method after calling the print driver.

member.name: T:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl
member.summary: The task guide control provides context sensitive task for a given application. The control takes an XML file or data stream describing the content and renders selected pages on the screen. Users may click on links and the task is performed by the application according the the "action" associated with the link in the XML file.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.Back
member.summary: The task guide control retains a history of visited context task guide pages. This method goes back to the previously visited page. If no history is available the function performs no operation.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.Forward
member.summary: The task guide control retains a history of visited context task guide pages. This method foward after the back button has been pressed one or more times. If no history is available the function performs no operation.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.AddPages(System.String)
member.summary: Adds pages to the task guide viewer control. The pages are defined using XML. This XML includes the names of header, labels, local links and universal resource locator links. For links, actions are defined to inform the application of the desired behavior when the link is clicked. Pages are accumulated with each AddPages call until the ClearContent method is called. Duplicate pages are replaced with the most recently added page.
member.param: The name of the file that contains the XML defining one or more task guide pages.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.AddPages(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds pages to the task guide viewer control. The pages are defined using XML. This XML includes the names of header, labels, local links and universal resource locator links. For links, actions are defined to inform the application of the desired behavior when the link is clicked. Pages are accumulated with each AddPages call until the ClearContent method is called. Duplicate pages are replaced with the most recently added page.
member.param: The name of the file that contains the XML defining one or more task guide pages.
Specifies whether to perform a validating reader using an imbedded schema or just a XML serializer.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.AddPages(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Adds pages to the task guide viewer control. The pages are defined using XML provided in the data strem. This XML includes the names of header, labels, local links and universal resource locator links. For links, actions are defined to inform the application of the desired behavior when the link is clicked. Pages are accumulated with each AddPages call until the ClearContent method is called. Duplicate pages are replaced with the most recently added page.
member.param: The data stream that contains XML used in defining one or more task guide pages.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.AddPages(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds pages to the task guide viewer control. The pages are defined using XML provided in the data strem. This XML includes the names of header, labels, local links and universal resource locator links. For links, actions are defined to inform the application of the desired behavior when the link is clicked. Pages are accumulated with each AddPages call until the ClearContent method is called. Duplicate pages are replaced with the most recently added page.
member.param: The data stream that contains XML used in defining one or more task guide pages.
Specifies whether to perform a validating reader using an imbedded schema or just a XML serializer.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.FastReader(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: This routine uses a custom written XML reader code to load the task pages much faster than the way originally generated by the XSD tool cutting a full half of a second off of an applications start up time.
member.param: The data stream that contains XML used in defining one or more task guide pages.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.ValidatingDeserialize(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: This routine uses the original validating XML reader. A peformance penalty of about a half second is paid. The XML serializer cost about the same as this validating reader code. This is much simpler than the fast code above but takes as much as a half second longer to load the pages (first time only).
member.param: The data stream that contains XML used in defining one or more task guide pages.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.LayoutControls
member.summary: This routine performs a layout of the controls. It creates the controls as per the current context name and places them in proper locations on page.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of the Font Height to the overall Caption Height. A ratio of 1 is the minimum. A ration of two creates a header twice the height of the caption text it contains. The default is 1.7 which creates a blank space one third of the caption text height above and below the text.

member.name: P:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.ImageNames
member.summary: Provides a list of names for the bitmap images. The names can be referenced in the XML source file respresenting task guide pages to provide bitmaps for the various link labels. Since the names are used to identify the proper bitmap images, the must match the order and number of images found in the ImageList. The first name identifies with the first image and so on.

member.name: P:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.CurrentPage
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current page displayed. The pages names are defined by the XML file defining the task guide pages.

member.summary: Occurs when the CurrentPage property on the task guide changes.

member.name: E:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.LoadPage
member.summary: Occurs when the current context page is changed to a missing page. Use this event to load missing pages dynamically.

member.name: P:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.BackPage
member.summary: Provides for 'go back' functionality found on the navigator bar. A history of visited pages is remembered. Each call to BackPage causes the previously visited page to be displayed. In addition, back pages may be programatically added by setting this property.

member.name: E:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.BackPageChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the name of the 'go back' page changes. This is the page that will be visited if the 'back' button is pressed or the BackPage method is called.

member.name: P:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.ForwardPage
member.summary: Provides for 'go forward' functionality found on the navigator bar. A history of visited pages is remembered. Each call to BackPage causes the previously visited page to be displayed. Each call to ForwardPage causes page to change back. When new pages are selected, the list of forward pages is cleared. In addition, forward pages may be programatically added by setting this property.

member.name: E:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.TaskGuideControl.ForwardPageChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the name of the 'go forward' page changes. This is the page that will be visited if the 'forward' button is pressed or the ForwardPage method is called.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.ErrorReporter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor that automatically generates the report contents based on the exception passed in. The errorSource will be prepended to the report.
member.param: The email address that the error report will be sent to.
The name of the app or particular code that sent this report. The ErrorReporterForm uses this name in the Error Report window's title bar.
The exception to report on. This will be appended to the errorReport string. Pass null if there is no exception.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.ErrorReporter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor that inserts the report contents passed in via errorReport and then prepends the errorSource to that report.
member.param: The email address that the error report will be sent to.
The name of the app or particular code that sent this report. The ErrorReporterForm uses this name in the Error Report window's title bar.
A string containing the report to send.

member.name: M:Agilent.TMFramework.InternalUtils.WinForms.ErrorReporter.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Constructor that inserts the report contents passed in via errorReport and then appends to that report the information associated with the exception passed in unless the exception is null. If the contactInfo parameter is not empty or null, that information will be prepended to the report contents as will the errorSource.
member.param: The email address that the error report will be sent to.
The name of the app or particular code that sent this report. The ErrorReporterForm uses this name in the Error Report window's title bar.
A string containing the report to send.
A string containing the end-user contact information
The exception to report on. This will be appended to the errorReport string. Pass null if there is no exception.
